benchmark_details.name: OCCULT
benchmark_details.overview: OCCULT introduces a methodology and evaluation framework for assessing large language models (LLMs) for offensive cyber operations (OCO). It includes three benchmarks: the Threat Actor Competency Test for LLMs (TACTL), the BloodHound Equivalency Test, and CyberLayer simulations, aimed at evaluating OCO capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized framework for evaluating the risks associated with large language models in offensive cyber operations.
tasks: Evaluation of Offensive Cyber Operation Capabilities

data.source: Prototyped cyber operation evaluations and benchmarks derived from practical offensive cyber operation scenarios.
data.annotation: Expert-defined evaluation questions and test scenarios relevant to offensive cyber operations.

methodology.calculation: Scores calculated based on the number of correct responses in multiple-choice formats.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate more capable LLMs in understanding and responding to offensive cyber operations.
methodology.baseline_results: Preliminary results show DeepSeek-R1 achieving 100% on TACTL benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Results validated through expert analysis and comparison with existing benchmarking frameworks.
